added etymology notes at beginning of article. love you guys ;)
Added information on fascist social Darwinism
/* Positions on culture and gender roles */
/* Positions on culture and gender roles */ Added information on the capital-"F" fascist British Union of Fascists' position on homosexuality and role of women
/* Positions on culture, gender roles and relations, and opposition to homosexuality */
/* Positions on culture, gender roles and relations, and sexual orientation */
/* Core tenets */ Reorganized the core tenets into a coherant body, removed some material that was repetitive, retained some possibly true points which don't yet have references
/* Anti-intellectualism */ This is only talking about the Nazis, the Italian Fascists encouraged intellectualism and created the Royal Academy to do so.

rev.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/24.16.205.181|24.16.205.181]] to last version by Pressforaction ([[WP:HG|HG]])
Rewrote the statements to be less POV
/* Positions on religion */ Weltanschauungen is plural
/* Political spectrum */ Added quote on Mussolini declaring fascism to be reactionary
/* Third Position economics */ introduced sentence explaining historical variations & changes adopted by economic policies, rendering characterization difficult
/* Political spectrum */ deleted sentence on [[A. James Gregor]] (this is giving UNDUE weight to a guy who apparently defended fascist ideas i mo
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Czarina666|Czarina666]] ([[User talk:Czarina666|talk]]) to last version by Collect
/* Notable Fascists */ Pelley religious and extremist - but not classic "fascist"
/* Fascist as epithet */ removed unneeded stuff
/* Political spectrum */ left right and center ref
/* Meaning of "fascism" */ clean up sentence structure
removed another partisan viewpoint that adds little to the article
/* Expansionism */ simplify ref to Italy and Germany
/* Fascist as epithet */ trimmed "arguably" and the like
/* Fascism as epithet */ to match wording in section and wikilink
/* Economic planning */ Haseler book named - may give a clue to readers
/* Economic planning */ doesnt matter whether its true or not, but that it's true that the author says this. it's clearly in the source.
/* Secondary sources */ not a serious or exemplary study of fascism. more relevant to partisan politics of the u.s..
This article needs to be reorganized, it drags on too much, especially in the sections explaining specific fascist movements
/* Positions on religion */ This section is too long and drifts from one topic to another
/* Positions on religion */ Why are a number of references mentioning the Islamic Revolution and Ayatollah Khomeni, the authoritarian Islamic theocracy of Iran is not directly related to fascism
/* Economic planning */ This claim about social democracy getting its economic ideas from fascism is dubious
/* Positions on racism and racialism */ Added more "citation needed" tags
/* Positions on abortion, eugenics and euthanasia */ This website link no longer accesses anything, it looked like it was from an unreliable source as well, so this sentence has been removed now
/* Positions on religion */ Added more "reference needed" tags
/* Positions on religion */ Removed an unreferenced claim that was left unsourced for many months
/* Positions on religion */ Added more "citation needed" tags
Adding "citation needed" tags to various parts of the article. Sources must be found for claims to keep this article from being sloppy.
/* Italian Fascism */ Huge real-life versions of this flag were seen flown alongside the Italian flag in the 1930s and 1940s, it is definately the political flag of the PNF
Added a reference for fascism's promotion of expansionism
Added another reference which was later down in the article which shows fascism's opposition to class conflict
Added fascist opposition to class conflict, fascists including Nazis saw national and racial conflict as requiring class collaboration

rev.user: The Thing That Should Not Be
rev.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/152.157.99.243|152.157.99.243]] to last version by DanielRigal ([[WP:HG|HG]])
/* Political spectrum */ this is a standard definition of socialism. why was it written like that?
/* Political spectrum */ deleted quotation mark that doesn't belong
nations do not "belong to a race" see cites
/* Etymology */ not all that rare -- vide US Mercury dimes
Fasces are bundles of rods, not ropes
/* Para-fascism and commonly alleged fascist ideologies */ minor copy edits
/* Imperial Rule Assistance Association (Japan) */ split into paragraphs
/* Authoritarianism and totalitarianism */ more formatting corrections
Added information that fascist governments suppressed all criticism and opposition
Mussolini accepted the existance of races in the 1920s. Hitler was a nationalist in that he sought Germany and Germans to be the ruling nation of the Aryan race.
/* Positions on racism and racialism */copy edit/cleanup, including deleting some repetition.redundancy
/* Authoritarianism and Totalitarianism */ corrected capitalization in heading
/* Political spectrum */ moved sentences to better spots, based on topics
/* Definitions */ copy edited and corrected formatting
/* Nationalism */ corrected formatting of quotes (some too short to be [[block quotation]]s)

main fascist movements were active before end of WWII, Griffin's old quote basically talks about neo-fascism
cites for use of empire wrt Italy and Germany
finally found a use for a colon!
rv to unaltered quote, better referenced quote
defining nation is a subjective task, [[nation]] can also be based on concepts of race, language, culture or anything really. Italian and most other fascisms were State-specifc nationalisms.
/* Positions on racism and racialism */ Put in the correct form of slashes
/* Positions on racism */ Added information on Benito Mussolini's view in the 1920s that the white race was being swamped by coloured races.

source says classical liberalism. modern liberalism wasnt around for them to oppose. they're the creators of it actually.

if we are qouting fascists themselves
how can something sourced by original research? the source explicitly says "classical liberalism"
"liberalism" in sources is usually referring to traditional liberalism, not modern American liberalism unless otherwise specified

Fascists oppose all kinds of [[liberalism]], not just [[classical liberalism]].
"classical" liberalism is necessary is it covers both economic liberalism and political liberalism. Laissez-faire economics was opposed.

"may" is a weak word for this sentence, "typically" is more accurate

paragraphing lede -- though I doubt the third belongs as it is a laundry list of all "not fascist" groups

hardly any scholarly cite, just a bunch of people calling him fascist

/* Economic planning */ Marxian socialism is a long term for communism, shortened down long sentences and removed some POV statements
/* Economic planning */ Shortened sentence removed U.S.-slanted bias, information on the creation of the U.S. Federal Reserve and income tax in the U.S. has no importance to European fascism
/* Political spectrum */ Oops, I forgot that in Italy, the Fascists officially rejected socialism entirely

again a mish-mash of a laundry list not properly in lede
trimmed lede as indicated in Talk page, laundry list of stuff unrelated to lede does not belong - thanks

according to the talk. consensus is against inclusion of hillbilly movement KKK. lone (American) ranger seems to think it warrants inclusion. states with no high culture to revive, have no fascism.
removed laundry list of attributes -- awaiting new lede definition per talk
removed laundry list of opposed movements - it seems to include almost everyone <g>
